instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down[/PLAIN]

Hi guys, working on a 2015 retina that has water damage spill around battery area and trackpad. But before i start replacing parts, i want to get the board working so i removed the board from the unit tested it with the lcd and i get the same problem, it shows battery charging indicator on screen and shuts down as if it sees a battery attached and its dead. So as we know no brd view is available i have no idea where the pull ups are for the data line going to the smc on the board. I managed to test the current sensing resistors around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and are within specs. There are no signs of water near the smc, also i did an smc bypass unit chimes and boots fine which could mean the smc is bad but i want to make sure the smc is not being tricked that the battery is dead from something else on the board. Any idea where i can find <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> on the board without the board view?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message: What is PPBUS voltage without battery connected?

threads.message: the problem is the battery is completely shot with corrosion so i really do believe the battery is bad, but i just need the unit to turn on but for some reason it thinks the battery is connected and is dead. What can cause the smc to think the battery is connected when its not ? Any ideas on that ?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message: Hi guys on this piece of crap board i managed to obtain a brd.view its a little different but the signal im getting is called <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> i get between 0.8xxV to 0.7XXv until it shuts down When off it is about 0.014 off is this normal? i checked pullup resistors and are in specs for smc.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message: Why don't you just get a battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message: Because the board is not turning on by itself that's why i don't think it's a battery when the board is plugged in no battery connected it wont turn on.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message: Current sense might have an issue... Really doubt it, but sometimes it causes wired issues... Check your battery and charger current sense resistors.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damage turns on shows battery indicator on screen then shuts down
threads.message: Solved smc reset solved the problem everyone keep this in mind if your having this issue with 2015 retina.
